entire functions, maximum principle

Consider the quadratic polynomial f(z)=z2−1f\p{z} = z^2 - 1f(z)=z2−1 on C\CC. We are interested in the iterates fnf^nfn of fff defined to be the identity on C\CC for n=0n = 0n=0 and as

fn=f∘⋯∘f⏟n factorsf^n = \underbrace{f \circ \cdots \circ f}_{n \text{ factors}}fn=n factorsf∘⋯∘f​​

for n∈Nn \in \Nn∈N.

  1. Find an explicit constant M>0M > 0M>0 such that the following dichotomy holds for each z∈Cz \in \Cz∈C: either (i) ∣fn(z)∣→∞\abs{f^n\p{z}} \to \infty∣fn(z)∣→∞ as n→∞n \to \inftyn→∞ or (ii) ∣fn(z)∣≤M\abs{f^n\p{z}} \leq M∣fn(z)∣≤M for all N∈N0N \in \N_0N∈N0​.

  2. Let UUU be the set of all z∈Cz \in \Cz∈C for which the first alternative (i) holds and KKK be the set of all z∈Cz \in \Cz∈C for which the second alternative (ii) holds.

    Show that UUU is an open set and KKK is a compact set without "holes", i.e., C∖K\C \setminus KC∖K has no bounded connected components.
Solution.

  1. Notice that if ∣z∣≥2\abs{z} \geq 2∣z∣≥2, then

    ∣f(z)∣=∣z−1z∣∣z∣≥∣∣z∣−1∣z∣∣∣z∣≥32∣z∣.\abs{f\p{z}} = \abs{z - \frac{1}{z}} \abs{z} \geq \abs{\abs{z} - \frac{1}{\abs{z}}} \abs{z} \geq \frac{3}{2}\abs{z}.∣f(z)∣=∣∣​z−z1​∣∣​∣z∣≥∣∣​∣z∣−∣z∣1​∣∣​∣z∣≥23​∣z∣.

    Hence,

    ∣fn(z)∣≥(32)n∣z∣≥2(32)n\abs{f^n\p{z}} \geq \p{\frac{3}{2}}^n \abs{z} \geq 2\p{\frac{3}{2}}^n∣fn(z)∣≥(23​)n∣z∣≥2(23​)n

    whenever ∣z∣≥2\abs{z} \geq 2∣z∣≥2. It follows that if ∣fk(z)∣≥2\abs{f^k\p{z}} \geq 2∣∣​fk(z)∣∣​≥2 for some kkk, then ∣fn(z)∣→∞\abs{f^n\p{z}} \to \infty∣fn(z)∣→∞. By contrapositive, if {fn(z)}n\set{f^n\p{z}}_n{fn(z)}n​ is bounded, then ∣fn(z)∣≤2\abs{f^n\p{z}} \leq 2∣fn(z)∣≤2. Hence, M=2M = 2M=2 works.

  2. Let Un=(fn)−1(M,∞)U_n = \p{f^n}^{-1}\p{M, \infty}Un​=(fn)−1(M,∞), which is open as the continuous preimage of an open set. By (1), we know that U=⋃nUnU = \bigcup_n U_nU=⋃n​Un​, so UUU is open.

    Since K=UcK = U^\compK=Uc, we see that KKK is closed. If z∈Kz \in Kz∈K, then ∣f0(z)∣=∣z∣≤M\abs{f^0\p{z}} = \abs{z} \leq M∣∣​f0(z)∣∣​=∣z∣≤M, i.e., KKK is bounded, hence compact.

    Now suppose that C∖K\C \setminus KC∖K has a bounded component CCC. Since ∂C⊆U\partial C \subseteq U∂C⊆U, the maximum principle tells us that ∣fn(z)∣≤M\abs{f^n\p{z}} \leq M∣fn(z)∣≤M for all z∈Cz \in Cz∈C and n∈Nn \in \Nn∈N, but this is a contradiction as ∣fn(z)∣→∞\abs{f^n\p{z}} \to \infty∣fn(z)∣→∞ in CCC.
